29 April. Demonstration action have been reported in Copesville. Police used teargas to disperse the crowds. [size=no report].
29 April. Tshwane residents demonstrated in front of the Union Buildings to hand over a list of demands regarding electricity billing. [size=no report].
30 April. Five demonstrators have been arrested after demonstrators locked the gates at Olifantspoort Pump Station and Water Treatment Plant. [size=no report].

30 April. Ethekwini Municipal workers demonstrated over promotions. The demonstrators said that promotions were only given to former liberation fighters. Police fired rubber bullets at the demonstrators. Demonstrators blocked roads with burning rubbish. [size=no report].

30 April. Demonstrators threw stones at the police in Elandsrand, Nyala. The demonstrators demanded the removal of the local mayor. Roads were blocked with stones. Police fired rubber bullets to disperse the crowds. Five people have been arrested. [size=no report].
30 April. The Economic Freedom Fighters (EFF) staged a demonstration in Bloemfontein (Mangaung). The demonstration was in response to service delivery issues. [size=5000].
30 April. Zone 7 residents in Thembalethu demonstrated outside the George Municipality, demanding the installation of two transformers. [size=100].

30 April. Demonstrators blocked the Soweto Highway and Odendaal Street with rocks and burning tyres. Johannesburg Metro Police Department (JMPD) officers were monitoring the situation. [size=no report].
30 April. A youth league member of the African National Congress was shot dead at his home in Ntshongweni, south of Cato Ridge, by two unknown gunmen. [size=2].

column7: Students (South Africa); EFFSC: Economic Freedom Fighters Students Command
column17: 01 May (on or around). Students, along with the Economic Freedom Fighters Student Command, protested at the University of KwaZulu-Natal Westville campus last week, demanding the reinstatement of the student representative council (SRC) at the campus. [size=no report].
05 January. Service delivery protest have been reported at Zandspruit informal settlement.

column7: SAMWU: South African Municipal Workers Union; Labour Group (South Africa)
column17: 02 May. Municipal employees, along with South African Municipal Workers' Union (Samwu), demonstrated inside the city hall. Entrances were blocked and rubbish were set alight. Police used teargas and rubber bullets to disperse the crowds. The demonstration was in response to promotions of former African National Congress military personnel. 31 people have been arrested and one person died during the demonstration. [size=3000].
02 May. Sakhisizwe village and municipality employees in Elliot demonstrated in front of the council offices over service delivery issues. [size=no report].

column7: NPSWU: National Public Service Workers Union; Labour Group (South Africa); Health Workers (South Africa)
column17: 02 May. Paramedics, community health workers and National Public Service Workers Union (NPSWU), demonstrated in the streets of the centre of Cape Town, demanding salary increases. The demonstration was in response to long working hours and dangerous working conditions. [size=no report].

02 May. Demonstration have been reported in Mandela Park, Khayelitsha. The demonstration was in response to factions of the Mandela Park Backyarders group selling houses illegally. The demonstrators blocked roads with bricks, burning tyres, and branches. A bus was also set alight. [size=no report].
03 May. A man has been arrested for setting alight Tlhakajeng Primary School in Kraaipan village during a demonstration. [size=no size].
03 May. Demonstrators demanded the release of four people who were arrested in a mob attack in Hoopstad. [size=60].

04 May. The body of a man believed to be a victim of a mob attack have been found near Shukushukuma informal settlement, Motherwell. The deceased was kidnapped and set alight. He had a pending case of possession of stolen property against him. According to police, the man was taken from his house on Saturday midday by a group of people who accused him of stealing building materials. [size=no report].
06 May. Stone-throwing have been reported on the R59, Vereeniging, during a demonstration. Two trucks have also been set alight. Police were reported to be on the scene. [size=no report].

06 May. Minibus taxis, in association with the Central Unity Taxi Association, blocked the roads in Green Point. The demonstrators are demanding that the City of Cape Town should issue to them operating licenses. 30 taxis were reported to block roads. [size=30].

column7: SAMWU: South African Municipal Workers Union; Labour Group (South Africa)
column17: On 06 May 2019, workers, associated with SA Municipal Workers Union (Samwu), disrupted water supply in Richards Bay in demonstration over labour issues. [size=no report].
06 May. Demonstrators blocked the road between Dutywa and Willowvale, Ginsberg, King William's Town, with burning tyres and rubble. Police used stun grenades to disperse the crowds. [size=no report].
06 May. Demonstration action was reported in Bushbuckridge in Mpumalanga during the casting of special votes. [size=no report].
06 May. Demonstration action were reported in Vuwani, Limpopo. One demonstrator has been arrested for intimidation. [size=no report].

column16: Cape Talk; EWN; East Coast Radio (South Africa)
column17: 06 May. Demonstration action were reported in Umlazi, Durban. Demonstrators barricaded the Mangosuthu Highway with tree branches and burning tyres. [size=no report].

07 May. Demonstration action has been reported in Reservoir Hills. Residents from Banana City Informal settlement blocked roads with burning tyres, rocks and tree branches. Police used rubber bullets to disperse the crowds. The demonstrators are demanding houses. [size=no report].
07 May. Construction workers working on the site of Noninzi Luzipho Primary School in KwaNobuhle township, Uitenhage demonstrated over not receiving training that was promised to them. [size=40].

07 May. Demonstration action have been reported in the Siqalo informal settlement in Mitchells Plain. The demonstration action has been in response to the housing development starting in the Woodlands and the demonstrators are demanding access to the land. A woman was hit in the face with a petrol bomb while on a bus and sustained serious burn wounds. Two demonstrators have been arrested. [size=no report].

08 May. Demonstrators affected the voting process in Ntlangano, Ntabankulu. Demonstrators are demanding the removal of the ward councillor, the completion of a road, electricity, and that a bridge should be constructed. [size=no report].
08 May. Protest action were reported on the N2, Higginson Highway, Westcliff, Chatsworth. [size=no report].
08 May. Police used teargas to disperse demonstrators in Mary Thiphe Road in Cato Crest, Durban. The demonstrators threw rocks at police officers. [size=no report].
08 May. Demonstration action delayed voting stations to open late in Folweni, Durban. Roads leading to the stations were blocked by demonstrations. [size=no report].
08 May. One demonstrator was arrested in Ntuzuma, Durban, during a demonstration that forced a voting station to be closed. [size=no report].
08 May. Demonstration action delayed voting stations to open late in Umbumbulu, Durban. Roads leading to the stations were blocked by demonstrations. [size=no report].
08 May. Protest action were reported in uMgababa, Durban. [size=no report].

08 May. Five demonstrators were arrested in Bergville, during a demonstration that forced a voting station to be closed. Demonstrators dug up trenches on roads towards voting stations in Escort and Bergville. [size=no report].
08 May. Residents from Holpan, Barkely West, disrupted elections. The demonstration was in response to service delivery issues. Demonstrators threw stones at the police. [size=900].

08 May. Demonstration action were reported in Plettenberg Bay. Demonstrators set tyres alight. The demonstrations were in response to service delivery issues. Police is monitoring the situation. [size=no report].

08 May. Residents from Vuwani and the police clashed during the elections. The demonstrators are demanding that the Vuwani area should be included in the Makhado municipality. Demonstrators barricaded roads. [size=no report].

column7: CSAAWU: Commercial, Stevedoring and Allied Workers Union
column17: 08 May. Workers demonstrated outside the wine farm in Grabouw. The workers are supported by the Commercial Stevedoring, Agricultural and Allied Workers Union (CSAAWU). The workers are demanding higher wages, the permanent employment of labour broker workers, that hostels should be converted into family units, and that workers who have been dismissed during the demonstration should be reinstated. [size=no report].
08 May. Demonstration action were reported in Strand. The demonstrations were in response to service delivery issues. [size=no report].
08 May. Police had to escort IEC officials to voting stations at Marquard due to service delivery demonstrations. [size=no report].
08 May. Demonstration action were reported in Khayelitsha. Demonstrators set tyres alight in Steve Biko Drive. The demonstrations were in response to service delivery issues. [size=no report].

column16: EWN; East Coast Radio (South Africa); Cape Talk
column17: 08 May. Police used rubber bullets to disperse demonstrators in Cato Manor. [size=no report].
08 May. Demonstration action were reported in Blackheath. The demonstrations were in response to service delivery issues. [size=no report].
08 May. Demonstration action were reported in Hout Bay. The demonstrations were in response to service delivery issues. [size=no report].
08 May. Residents from Stickfarm, Umzinto, blocked voting stations, demanding that housing issues should be resolved. [size=no report].

column7: Labour Group (South Africa); Health Workers (South Africa)
column17: 08 May. Employees from the National Health Department demonstrated outside the Civitas building, Pretoria. The demonstration was in response to the poor conditions of buildings where staff are expected to live. [size=no report].
08 May. Demonstration action were reported in Mfuleni. The demonstrations were in response to service delivery issues. [size=no report].
08 May. Demonstration action were reported in Caledon. The demonstrations were in response to service delivery issues. [size=no report].
09 May. Demonstration action have been reported at the newly build reservoir in Etwatwa. [size=no report].

column7: NUPSAW: National Union of Public Service and Allied Workers; Health Workers (South Africa)
column17: 09 May. Paramedics and health workers associated with the National Public Service Workers Union (Npswu), marched to the Western Cape Department of Health Cape Town. The demonstration was in response to long working hours and dangerous working conditions. [size=no report].

20 May 2019. Two metro police officers have been shot dead while being stationed outside an ANC councillor's house in Verulam, Durban for protection. Their firearms have been stolen. Three suspects have been arrested in connection to the shooting. The incident took place during heightened service delivery demonstrations in the area.

11 May. Ban Animal Trading (BAT) staged a demonstration at the Ushaka Marine World, Durban. The demonstration was to raise awareness on the struggles of marine life that is held in captivity. [size=no report].
11 May. Three houses were damaged in Zwelihle, Hermanus, in what is said to be in response to the owners not voting during the elections. An EFF supported were among those arrested. [size=no report].
13 May. Demonstration action have been reported in Steelpoort. Demonstrators blocked the Tworiver Platinum Mine crossing, Sekhukune and Tweefontein roads. [size=no report].
13 May. A man was set alight by the members of the Daveyton East Rand. He was accused of robbing a woman of her handbag. [size=no report].

column7: NCFAWU: National Certificated Fishing and Allied Workers Union; Women (South Africa)
column17: 13 May. Demonstrators damaged two vehicles during a demonstration in Touwsranten. Roads were blocked with burning tyres. The public order police (Pops) were on the scene to disperse a group of about 80 women who were armed with branches and stones. The demonstrators were supported by the trade union NCFAWU (National Certificated Fishing & Allied Workers Union). The demonstration was in response to wage disputes with the Mandalay farm. One worker from the farm have been hit with a rock during the demonstration. [size=80].

column7: CSAAWU: Commercial, Stevedoring and Allied Workers Union
column17: 13 May. Demonstration action have been reported on the N2 between Sir Lowry's Pass and Grabouw. The demonstration was in response to the Oak Valley Wine Estate rejecting workers demands. The workers are demanding a minimum wage of ZAR250 per day, accommodation, and the permanent appointment of seasonal workers. The workers are supported by the Commercial Stevedoring, Agricultural and Allied Workers Union (CSAAWU). Eight demonstrators have been arrested after they clashed with the police. [size=60].
13 May. Parents, teachers, and students demonstrated at the Gqumashe Primary School in Alice in the Eastern Cape over the poor state of the school. [size=no report].

14 May. Demonstrations have been reported at the Corner Sheffield and Wellington roads, Lenasia. The demonstration was in response to the land grabs happening in the area. Roads were blocked with burning tyres and rocks. [size=no report].

14 May. Parents demonstrated at the Bhekabantu Primary School in Tafuleni, Pietermaritzburg. The demonstration was in response to the poor state of the toilets at the school. The parents locked the principal and teachers out, demanding the principal t be fired. Roads were barricaded and broken bottles were thrown on the road. [size=no report].

15 May. Truck owners block the roads leading to the Durban Container Terminal in response to their demands of efficient services not being met. The demonstrators are demanding to meet Transnet. According to demonstrators, equipment is not being maintained and the terminal has staffing problems. About 485 trucks blocked the entrance. [size= 485].

15 May. Residents from the Imbali Township, Pietermaritzburg, blocked the R56. The demonstration started on the 13th of May. Roads were blocked with burning tyres and rubble. The demonstration was in response to service delivery issues. [size=no report].
15 May. Residents from Driekwart farm near Mondlo, blocked the roads between Mondlo and Vryheid with burning trees during a demonstration over service delivery issues. [size=no report].

15 May. East Street Hostel dwellers, Pietermaritzburg, blocked the Masukwana Street with burning tyres and litter. Demonstrators were armed with sticks and broken bottles. The demonstration was in response to the power that were cut off at the hostel. Police dispersed the crowds. The demonstrators demanded to speak to the mayor. [size=150].

15 May. Workers from Eskom's Kusile Power Station in Mpumalanga have been dismissed following demonstrations during the month. Workers have demonstrated over delayed wage payments. Roughly 500 workers have been dismissed over demonstrations. [size=500].
16 May. Students blocked a road in Kraaifontein, Cape Town in demonstration over-crowded classrooms at four schools in the area. [size=1000].

16 May. Afriforum submitted demonstration letters at the National Department of Cooperative Governance and Traditional Affairs in Pretoria. The demonstration letters were in response to the presidential request that 18,000 across South Africa should be transported to the presidential inauguration that is set to take place on the 25th of May. [size=no report].
16 May. Residents from Khokhwane, Pietermaritzburg, blocked roads with burning tyres and rocks. The demonstration was in response to a lack of clean drinking water. [size=no report].
16 May. Demonstrations have been reported in Jozini, northern KwaZulu Natal. Demonstrators are demanding water. Roads were blocked with stones. [size=no report].
16 May. Demonstration action have been reported at the Canyon Coal, Slovo Park. Demonstrators are demanding jobs from the mine. [size=no report].

On 18 May 2019, residents from Senekal (Thabo Mofutsanyana, Free State) set the municipality offices and a community hall alight during a violent demonstration. Shops owned by foreign nationals were also looted and roads were blocked with rocks. The demonstration occurred after the mayor told residents that there was no budget for free stands and due to a lack of service delivery. The police have arrested 45 demonstrators for public violence. [size=no report].

On 18 May 2019, a group of unidentified men threw stones at a Zimbabwean truck, shattering the windshield, injuring the driver, and forcing him to stop the vehicle in Mooi River (uMgungundlovu, KwaZulu-Natal) in a suspected xenophobic attack. No casualties reported. [size=no report]
19 May. A mob has beaten three men, suspected of attacking and robbing an elderly woman in Ga-Wally village in Mokwakwaila (Tzaneen), to death. [size=no report].
20 May. A suspected serial rapist has been burned to death by a mob in Govan Mbeki kasi, Port Elizabeth. [size=150].

20 May. Residents from Henley Village, Pietermaritzburg, demonstrated over not having access to water. Demonstrators used burning tyres and bricks to block the R103. Police used rubber bullets and teargas to disperse the crowds. Two demonstrators were injured and one was hospitalised. [size=no report].

20 May. Board members, parents, and students from the Zonkizizwe Secondary school demonstrated outside the school in Katlegong, East of Johanneburg. The demonstration was in response to the reinstatement of the principal who failed to submit exam papers of 60 students in 2017. [size=no report].

20 May. Demonstrators gathers outside the Pietermaritzburg High Court to show support to former president, Jacob Zuma, during his court case. He faces charges that include fraud, corruption and racketeering. [size=50].
20 May. Esikhaleni residents demonstrated over construction companies that do not hire locals from the community. The demonstration stared on Friday. [size=no report].

20 May. Residents from Kwazenzele township, near Springs on the East Rand, closed the R29 road with rocks and burning tyres. The demonstration is in response to a coal mine being granted a mining licence within the area without the consultation with the community. The community is also demonstrating, demanding houses. Police fired rubber bullets at the demonstrators to disperse the crowds. [size=no report].
21 May. Citizens from Mozambique demonstrated outside the Mhala Home Affairs (Bushbuckridge), demanding identification documents that have been blocked by Home Affairs. [size=no report].

21 May. Demonstration action at the University of the Free State campus, Bloemfontein, turned violent when students a senior financial official got involved in a scuffle with demonstrating students who were demonstrating over delayed NSFAS payments. [size=no report].

22 May. Yeoville residents have blocked roads with rocks and burning tyres since Monday. The demonstration occurred after a man was sht dead at a petrol station during an armed robbery. [size=no report].

22 May. Demonstration action have been reported near Atok. Residents from the Burgersfort Municipality blocked the road near Atok with burning tyres. The demonstrators are demanding that a road in the community should be tarred. [size=no report].

column7: NUM: National Union of Mineworkers; Labour Group (South Africa)
column17: 22 May. Miners demonstrated at the Orkney mine through a five-day sit in, demanding a wage increment. National Union of Mineworkers (NUM) were negotiating with the Chinese Africa Precious Metal Company. [size=69].

22 May. Demonstration action have been reported outside Parliament, Cape Town, during the inauguration of new members of parliament. The demonstrators called upon the new members to uphold the constitution during their term. [size=no report].

column16: East Coast Radio (South Africa); Mercury (South Africa)
column17: 22 May. Demonstrations in Bhobhoyi in Port Shepstone entered its second day. Demonstrators blocked roads with rocks and burning rubble. The demonstration was in response to the poor conditions of roads. Police is on the scene to monitor the situation. 47 Demonstrators have been arrested. [size=no report].
22 May. Elundini workers blockaded the entrance of the Maclear municipal offices, demanding to speak to the mayor. [size=no response].
23 May. SACP supporters demonstrated in front of the offices of the Department of Education, Pietermaritzburg, demanding transport for students from farming communities. [size=no report].

23 May. Demonstration action were reported in Klipspruit, Soweto. The demonstration was in response to high levels of crime in the area. Demonstrators blocked the Klipspruit Valley Road with rocks and burning tyres. [size=80].

23 May. Hundreds of residents from the Marikana Informal Settlement have marched to the Western Cape Premieris office in the City of Cape Town to hand over a memorandum with demands. The demands include land, electricity, toilets, and roads within the informal settlement. [size=300].

23 May. Residents and African National Congress (ANC) supporters demonstrated in Mdantsane, calling the ANC to dismiss the ward 20 councillor, Ntombizodwa Gamnca, after she removed the PR councillor from the ward office who have been appointed to act in her place after her suspension. Demonstrators burnt tyres in front of the municipal offices. [size=13].
24 May. Students from Cape Town joined thousands in demonstration, calling for action on climate change. [size=no report].

24 May. Demonstration action in Umhlumayo have been reported. Demonstrators blocked roads with rocks and tree branches. The demonstration was over service delivery issues. Demonstrators are demanding running water. [size=no report].

24 May. Parents of students from the Klipspringer Primary School, Nelspruit, demonstrated in front of the school in response to students being cramped up in classrooms and over structural issues of the school buildings that poses a threat the student's safety. [size=no report].

column7: ABMSM: Abahlali Basemjondolo Shack Dwellers Movement; ACM: Active Citizen Movement; Market Users Committee; Bunye bamaHostela; Poor Flat Dwellers Association; Right2Know; Mayine; SDCEA: South Durban Environmental Alliance
column17: 25 May (on or around). Various activist groups demonstrated at the City Hall in Durban, calling for the current major to resign. These groups included: Active Citizens Movement, Abahlali baseMjondolo, the Market Users Committee, Bunye bamaHostela, the Poor Flat Dwellers Association, Right2Know KZN, Mayine, and the South Durban Community Environmental Alliance. [size=1000].

25 May (on or around). A Khoi-San chief and two fellow activists have been released from police custody followed their involvement in a demonstration over the weekend. The demonstrators, armed, went on a motorcade, demanding gangsters within their area in Northen Port Elizabeth, to come out of their houses. [size=no report].

26 May. Animal activists and rescue organisations have demonstrated outside the Chinese consulate in Durban. The demonstration was in response to the annual Lychee and Dog Meat festival in Yulin, China, where thousands of dogs and cats will be eaten. A handful of demonstrators have been present. [size=10].
27 May. Roads in Davidsonville, Roodepoort, have been blocked with burning tyres and rocks by demonstrators who are demanding City Power to fix their faulty electricity meters. [size=no report].

column16: South African Police Service; Jacaranda FM
column17: 27 May. Demonstration action have been reported in Atteridgeville, north of Pretoria. Police arrested seven demonstrators for public violence. Residents from Jeffsville and Phomolong Informal Settlements marched to the municipal offices, demanding to be addressed by MMC of Infrastructure in Tshwane. The demonstrators threw rocks and bottles at the police. The demonstrators also broke the fence of the municipality, burned some of the offices, and damaged 16 vehicles. [size=4000].
27 May (on or around). Demonstrators set a Rea Vaya bus and a truck alight during a demonstration Mzimhlophe, Soweto. Demonstrators are demanding water and electricity. [size=no report].

27 May. Demonstration action have been reported at the Dundee and Vryheid road. Demonstrators blocked with burning tyres. The demonstration was in response to the Department of Transport hiring temporary workers that is not from the area. Police was on the scene. [size=no report].

28 May. Economic Freedom Fighters (EFF) members have demonstrated in front of the Oyster Box Hotel, Durban. The demonstrators are said to be acting on behalf of employees on the hotel who were treated unfairly. [size=15].
28 May. Residents of Kwathema Extension Three, Springs demonstrated against a group of vigilantes who call themselves Boko Haram. The demonstrators burnt tyres and blocked roads. [size=no report].
28 May. A school in Mvutshini, near Margate, have been burnt down by demonstrators who demanded water services and improved roads. [size=no report].

28 May. Protest action have been reported at the Department of Home Affairs, Witbank. The Waya Waya Community of Phola is unhappy with a member of the department and over service delivery. [size=no report].
28 May. Khayelitsha, Kraaifontein and Philippi residents, led by the Social Justice Coalition (SJC), demonstrated in Rondebosch over badly light streets. [size=200].

29 May. Residents and African National Congress (ANC) supporters disrupted a budget meeting at the East London City Hall. Demonstrators are calling for the removal of the ward 20 councillor, Ntombizodwa Gamnca. Police pushed the demonstrators out of the city hall. [size=no report].
29 May. Community members blocked roads in front of the Libode magistrate's court, demanding that the men accused of abducting a businessman for ransom, not receive bail. [size=no report].

29 May. Residents from Umlazi blocked roads with burning tyres in Durban, demanding a by-election in their ward. The residents said that they did not choose to be represented by councillor Mthokozisi Nojiyeza, who have faced murder charges. [size=100].
29 May. A couple of dozen evicted land occupiers have been staying in community halls have marched to City of Cape Town municipality's offices in Strand, demanding houses. [size=24].

29 May. Rouxville residents blocked the N6 highway. The demonstration started off peacefully when the demonstrators marched to the local municipality. The demonstrators however started throwing stones at the building and threatened to burn the building down after they heard that no one from the municipality will address them. The demonstrators are demanding municipal jobs that they said was promised to them before the national elections. [size=no report].

29 May. Residents from Emaphephethweni in Inanda, north of Durban, blocked the entrances of the area with burning tyres, demanding water and houses. The demonstrators said that they have been without water for five years. [size=no report].
30 May. Housing demonstrations have taken place in Mfuleni, Cape Town. Roads were blocked. Police used rubber bullets to disperse the crowds. [size=no report].

30 May. Builders demonstrated outside the Nelson Mandela Bay Metropolitan Municipality council chambers, demanding a report on the value of the RDP houses that have been build since 2004. The demonstrators believe they have been exploited and underpaid. [size=50].

30 May. Demonstrators blocked a road in front of Mbalenhle clinic, Pietermaritzburg, with burning tyres and rocks. The demonstrators claim that they have been promised jobs at the clinic. Police used teargas to disperse the crowds. Eight demonstrators have been arrested. [size=12].

30 May. Members of the Reclaim the City (RTC), a housing activist group, demonstrated inside a city council meeting in Cape Town. The demonstrators are demanding an investigation into the sale of land to GrowthPoint. [size=20].

31 May (on or around). Vryheid community members demonstrated outside the Transnet buildings, demanding jobs. The demonstrators claim that Transnet hired mostly employees from outside the community. [size=no report].
31 May. Demonstration action have been reported in Sandton. Demonstrators, led by the African National Congress, are demanding the renaming of Sandton Drive. [size=no report].
31 May. Residents from Diepsloot marched against violence within their community, calling for more police visibility. [size=no report].
31 May. Children from Mamelodi marched within the area against child abuse. [size=no report].

31 May. Residents of Alexandra have burned an electricity transformer at the Marlboro Gautrain station during a demonstration after their houses have been demolished. Police fired rubber bullets at the crowds. [size=no report].
31 May. Emjindini residents marched to the Barberton police station following another death of a young woman who have been killed. [size=no report].
On 1 June 2019, a truck driven by a Zimbabwean driver was shot at six times between Durban and Johannesburg (City of Johannesburg, Gauteng) in a suspected xenophobic attack. No casualties reported.

01 June. Vosho informal settlement residents blocked the Baden Powell Drive in Khayelitsha, Cape Town with burned tyres and tree branches. The demonstration was in response to the police breaking down some of the houses within the Vosho settlement. One demonstrator has been arrested. [size=60].
On 03 June 2019, workers at the Saartjie Baartman Centre held a demonstration outside their offices in Athlone to stand against child abuse. [size=no report].
03 June. Tshwane North College, Mamelodi are demonstrating in front of the campus, refusing to write exams until they receive their NSFAS allowances. [size=no report].
03 June. A silent demonstration was held against child abuse at the Saartjie Baartman Centre, Cape Town. [size=no report].
04 June. Members from the Afrika Tikkun non-government organisation marched in Mfuleni to raise awareness on child safety. [size=no report].

column7: ANCYL: African National Congress Youth League
column17: 04 June. ANC Youth League (ANCYL) members marched to the ANC's Luthuli House headquarters, Johannesburg, calling for the disbandment of the ANCYL national structure, which has been in place since 2015. [size=no report].
05 June (on or around). Demonstrators in Zebediela, Limpopo set a light a classroom last week. The demonstrators were demanding the tarring of the main road. [size=no report].

column9: SPCA: Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals
column17: 05 June. A mob from Eldorado Park assaulted two Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals (SPCA) inspectors with bricks and smashed their vehicle windows. [size=no report].
05 June. Senior citizens from Mabopane demonstrated outside the community hall. The demonstration was in response to elderly abuse in the community. [size=no report].

05 June. Hundreds, led by the Alliance for Rural Democracy (ARD), have demonstrated at the Union Buildings, Pretoria, in demonstration against the Bantustan Bills that will allow traditional leaders to have agreements with mining companies without the consent from their communities. [size=100].

05 June. A man was beaten up by community members in Lentegeur, Cape Town after he shot and killed an alleged Sexy Boys gang boss and his 20-year-old son. Police intervened and arrested the shooter. [size=no report].

column7: ANCYL: African National Congress Youth League
column17: 06 June. African National Youth League (ANCYL) supporters demonstrated outside the Newcastle Municipality gates, demanding to enter the gates to attend the press briefing held by the mayor of Newcastle. [size=no report].

06 June. Unemployed security guards have marched to the Port Elizabeth municipality, demanding that employment within the municipality should be insourced. The demonstrators are demanding that the municipality should appoint over 550 security guards who are currently unemployed. [size=200].
06 June. Workers working on the RDP project in Gunguluza, Uitenhage have demonstrated in front of the Power Construction Company, demanding their salaries. [size=no report].

06 June. Vlakfontein residents blocked roads with burning tyres. The demonstration was against the National Prosecuting Authority's (NPA) decision to drop all charges against the man who's believed to have killed seven members of the Khoza family. [size=no report].

07 June. Social Crime Prevention Programme volunteers marched to the KwaZulu-Natal Community Safety Department, Pietermaritzburg, demanding better treatment. The demonstration was also in response to the volunteers' stipends being decreased. [size=no report].

07 June. A man has been killed by community members in Moletjie Ga-Makibelo village, outside Seshego during, what police believe, has been a case of mob justice. Police have arrested two men. [size=no report].
07 June. Residents from Mabopane blocked roads with burning tyres and branches. The demonstration was in response to residents being without water for four days. [size=100].
07 June. Supporters of the Land Party leader Gcobani Ndzongana, who have been charged for damage to property, have demonstrated outside the courthouse in Stellenbosch. [size=300].
07 June. Employees from Featherbed, Knysna, marched to the company, to express their anger over the notification the company send over retrenchments. [size=20-30].
09 June. Residents from Bester informal settlement, KwaMashu, assaulted two men who stabbed and robbed a woman. [size=no report].
10 June. eThekwini metro workers blocked the Mangosuthu Highway in Umlazi with trash and burning tires. The demonstration was over a labour dispute. [size=no report].
10 June. Students burnt three university cars during a demonstration over NSFAS allowances at the Zamakulungisa campus in Mthatha. [size=no report].

10 June. eMganduzweni residents from White River, barricaded roads and hijacked a bus, demanding the release of two suspects who have been arrested in connection with the murder of a local pastor. The demonstrators believe that the two suspects are innocent. [size=no report].

The demonstration was in response to the company wanting to implement a multi-shift system which the workers believe will lead to them earning less. [size=300].

12 June (on or around). Demonstration action was reported at the Umzumbe Municipality. The demonstration was said to be in response to dissatisfaction over the local councilor, a lack of a clinic, and the poor state of roads and housing infrastructures. [size=no report].

14 June. Community members from Kya Sand and Msawawa demonstrated in Kya Sand, Johannesburg, demanding service delivery and RDP houses. [size=no report].

column7: African Climate Youth Alliance; Students (South Africa)
column17: On 14 June 2019, students marched from Parliament to City Hall in Cape Town, demanding government to take immediate action on climate change. The marched was led by the African Climate Youth Alliance. [size=300].

15 June. Community members castrated and killed a man in Ivory Park, Tembisa, who was accused of being part of a gang who allegedly raped two girls. A member of the community saw the incident alerted members of the community who came to confront the men. [size=no report].

column8: Police Forces of Mozambique (1990-) Mozambican Frontier Guard
column17: 16 June. A shootout between the South African Defence Force and the Mozambican border guards have been reported on the border near Ndumo, KwaZulu-Natal. Two Mozambican border officers have been killed. Information on the event is limited.

18 June. Supporters of the eThekwini mayor Zandile Gumede who was suspended, have marched to the Durban City Hall, demanding that her suspension to be lifted and for the municipal manager Sipho Nzuza vacate his position. Demonstrators are also demanding the disbandment of the ANC's regional executive committee to be reversed. Demonstrators tried to kick in the doors of the municipal office. Police had to intervene to stop the demonstrators, wearing African National Congress (ANC) regalia. Various members and councilors of the ANC joined the demonstration. [size=100].

The demonstrators are demanding better service delivery within their informal settlement. The demonstration was also against the demolition of 80 houses by the red ants within their community. Police attempted to stop the demonstrators from entering the city center of Sandton. [size=200].

Students from representative bodies of universities across South Africa marched to the National Student Financial Aid Scheme offices in Cape Town, demanding that historical debt should be written off, the finalization of NSFAS appeals, and that allowances should be paid on time. [size= no report].

Diepsloot residents, along with Green Door Diepsloot (a shelter for women and children who are the victims of violence) staff marched through the streets of Diepsloot during an anti-rape peaceful demonstration. The aim of the demonstration was to make community members aware of the procedures of reporting rape, gender violence, and child abuse. [size=no report].

Black subcontractors, along with small, medium and micro-sized enterprises (SMMEs), from Kidd's Beach, outside East London, the held a peaceful demonstration, demanding that 30% of the projects, that include a shopping mall, a school, and a hospital, should be rewarded to them. The demonstrators said that black subcontractors within the area have been overlooked in the past during the allocation of contracts. [size=50].

The demonstrators are demanding disciplinary action, the suspension of the captain and the Human Resource (HR) manager, and the reinstatement of employees who were dismissed last year for their participation in a NUMSA led demonstration. 22 June. Demonstrators marched from King Dinuzulu Park, Greyville to Durban City Hall to show solidarity for Sudan. [size=no report].

Residents from Zwezwe informal settlement in Dunoon barricaded roads with burning tires, pelted stones at vehicles, and set a truck alight during a demonstration over the demolition of their houses that was erected on private land. column16: Mercury (South Africa); East Coast Radio (South Africa); Daily News (South Africa)
column17: 02 July. Demonstrators blocked roads with burning refuse and set a municipal vehicle alight in demonstration over the alleged reinstatement of a former African National Congress (ANC) regional secretary, who have been convicted for murder, at the KwaDukuza local municipality. The demonstration was led by some of the members of the ANC. [size=no report].
03 July. A mob attacked two women who were accused of the murdering of a young boy whose body was found in a river. The mob, stripped the victims naked and set them on fire. [size=no report].

The demonstration is in response to the residents receiving final demand letters on their debt relating to water, electricity, and rent. According to the demonstrators, they have been overcharged. [size=no report].

column16: Star (South Africa); eNCA (South Africa); Boksburg advertiser
column17: 04 July. The roads between Orlando East Mooki street, two Reavaya bus stations, and Orland police station have been barricaded by residents, who are demonstrating against a lack of electricity within the community after a transformer have exploded, with burning tires. The demonstrations started on Tuesday. A school was vandalized during the demonstrations. [size=no report].

The demonstration is in response to service delivery and housing issues that was outlined in a list of demands that were handed to the municipality on the 18th of June. Police used rubber bullets and teargas to disperse the demonstrators. 71 people have been arrested for public violence. [size=71].

The woman managed to escape and called for help followed by the community going to the house where the incident took place. Police have taken in one person for questioning. [size=10].

09 July. Protesters gathered outside the Bedfordview Police Station. The demonstrators were demanding the release of a man who have been arrested the night before. The man belonged to a group that assaulted a man suspected of cable theft. Police used rubber bullets to disperse the crowds who blocked off the entrance to the police station. [size=no report].

10 July. Demonstrations have been reported in Letsopa. Demonstrators set alight municipal offices and damaged other properties. Roads were barricaded with burning tires and stones, eighteen people were arrested for public violence. [size=no report].
10 July. Protests have been reported in Kaalfontein. The demonstration was in response to residents not having electricity for three weeks. [size=no report].

column7: SATAWU: South African Transport and Allied Workers Union; Labour Group (South Africa)
column17: 10 July. Members from SATAWU Welkom marched to the Matjhabeng Local Municipality, demanding that the municipality pay outstanding debt to Man in One Security, MBV Security and Scheme Security. [size=no report].

10 July. Protests have been reported at Cork Trust in Kruger, near the R536 road. [size=no report].
11 July. Demonstration action have been reported in Modder East, outside the Gold One Mine in Springs. Demonstrators are demanding jobs. Roads were barricaded with burning tires. [size=no report].

11 July. Demonstrators have clashed with police in Durban. The demonstrators are demanding that the municipality reinstate suspended mayor, Zandile Gumede. Police have fired stun grenades at the demonstrators. [size=no report].
12 July. Residents from Hermanus held protests in response to businesses employing more foreign citizens than local residents. [size=no report].

The meeting took place after 300 pupils and their parents demonstrated in front of another primary school on the 5ht, demanding that the school enroll the pupil. [size=300].

column17: 15 July. Demonstrations have been reported in Uniondale. A municipal vehicle was set on fire. The demonstration was in response to the downgrading of the fire station. A farmer shot began shooting at the demonstrators, injuring three demonstrators. [size=no report].

column9: IFP: Inkatha Freedom Party; Government of South Africa (1994-)
column17: 16 July. An IFP councilor was injured when unidentified gunmen open fire on his car while he was driving to KwaDukuza.

Demonstrators are demanding government to fix their homes that have been damaged in a storm in 2012. Roads have been barricaded with rocks and stones. A municipal vehicle has also been set alight. [size=26].
